intro: Kaulinia pteropus, commonly known as the winged kaulinia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs characterized by their aromatic wood and often compound leaves. The plant is distinguished by its unique winged fruits, which are adapted for wind dispersal. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
